title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 February 2014 - XWiki
content:

10:02 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> hi  
10:18 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> can we commit on the 5.4.x branch ?  
10:51 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: why not ?  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> don't we plan to release 5.4.2 today ?  
10:54 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: what you need to commit is not required for 5.4.2 ?  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> I was thinking about XWIKI-9671  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> we said we need to release a version of wiki-manager without the REST api  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> now it's done in 5.4  
10:56 <gdelhumeau> so we can remove wiki-manager in 5.4.2, we are not forced to wait for 6.0  
10:56 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: XWIKI-9671 is not for 4.5.x IMO  
10:56 <tmortagne> this is a 6.x thing  
10:56 <tmortagne> we are not going to delete in 5.4.2 a whole module released in 5.4 and 5.4.1  
10:57 <gdelhumeau> ok  
10:57 <tmortagne> you can do it right now in 6.0 branch  
10:57 <tmortagne> you don't need to wait anything  
10:58 <GuillaumeF> has quit

12:58 <vmassol> done  
13:42 <mflorea> has quit  
14:01 <vmassol> has quit  
14:02 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <polx> has quit  
14:22 <woshilapin> has quit  
14:26 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <woshilapin> has quit  
14:36 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:38 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <evalica1> has quit  
14:53 <vmassol> hi guys  
14:53 <vmassol> do we have a volunteer RM for the 5.4.2 release?  
14:53 <gdelhumeau> I can  
14:53 <vmassol> ok cool, thanks  
14:54 <vmassol> mflorea: what's the status re what you were saying last Friday? You were saying you might need one more day which I guess is end of today  
14:54 <vmassol> will you be ready for a release tomorrow morning?  
14:57 <mflorea> vmassol: no, I haven't progressed unfortunately, XWIKI-10003. I've send a mail to solr users lists but the responses weren't very useful so I'm still digging. Sorry  
14:57 <vmassol> mflorea: is that the only outstanding issue?  
14:57 <mflorea> no  
14:57 <vmassol> so what about the rest?  
14:58 <mflorea> I need time for them too  
14:58 <mflorea> I think the earliest is Wednesday morning for the 5.4.2  
14:58 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <vmassol> how much longer do you need?  
14:59 <vmassol> soory  
14:59 <vmassol> missed your message  
15:00 <vmassol> that's excluding 10003?  
15:00 <vmassol> I guess it depends on whethre you find a solution for it or not  
15:01 <mflorea> yes, which hopefully is just a configuration problem  
15:01 <vmassol> maybe you should focus on what you can do ATM while waiting for some answer from the list  
15:01 <mflorea> yes, I'm working on other issues at the same time :)  
15:01 <vmassol> and then we can decide on Wednesday morning if we release a 5.4.2 and thus create a 5.4.3 for 10003 later or not  
15:01 <mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10048  
15:03 <vmassol> ok so gdelhumeau please make sure everything is ready for a release this Wednesday. Get people to fix CI jobs, etc :)  
15:04 <gdelhumeau> ok  
15:04 <vmassol> you could prepare the jira dashboard for 5.4.2 too  
15:05 <gdelhumeau> already done  
15:05 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=12091  
15:05 <vmassol> cool  
15:09 <vmassol> mflorea: there's also http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9716  
15:09 <vmassol> and http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10004  
15:10 <mflorea> for this I need to find a workaround as fixing it is too dangerous for 5.4.x  
15:10 <mflorea> 10004 is relatively easy, no surprises there  
15:10 <vmassol> ok  
15:11 <vmassol> and for DM/EM: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9199 http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9595  
15:11 <mflorea> I need to check the object property type and display a facet based on that type (e.g. date facet for date properties, user facet for List of Users props)  
15:11 <vmassol> so quite a lot for you :)  
15:11 <vmassol> anything where other devs could help you?  
15:12 <mflorea> from these two only the last is mandatory, I said initially that I wouldn't have time for both.  
15:12 <mflorea> the first doesn't have the roadmap54x label  
15:12 <vmassol> ok I'll update some doc  
15:12 <vmassol> well it has roadmap54 as label ATM  
15:13 <vmassol> same for both actually they have only roadmap54 as labels  
15:13 <mflorea> yes, but there were other stuff added for 5.4.2 that weren't planned for 5.4  
15:13 <mflorea> so I couldn't to all  
15:13 <mflorea> s/do/take  
15:13 <vmassol> ok I'll check with Silvia if she knows about that  
15:14 <vmassol> so right now you're planning to do 9595 but not 9199 right?  
15:14 <mflorea> yes  
15:14 <vmassol> ok  thanks  
15:22 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
15:38 <lucaa> hello guys  
15:38 <lucaa> assuming I am doing the unthinkable and changing the behaviour of a function between 2 versions of an extension.  
15:38 <lucaa> is there a javadoc tag or something that I could put to mark that that function has changed behaviour?  
15:58 <Slashman> has quit  
15:58 <msmeria> tmortagne: hello. I tested XWIKI-10056 on both 5.4.2 and 6.0 and it's fixed  
15:59 <msmeria> thanks!  
15:59 <tmortagne> msmeria: ok cool :)  
16:00 <tmortagne> lucaa: I don't have anything in mind no since doing that is more or less supposed to be a bug :)  
16:01 <lucaa> well, I think we did the same when we decided to change the default resolver for the model script service functions or something like that  
16:01 <tmortagne> the problem is that putting anything in the javadoc won't help people that are using the API before you changed it  
16:01 <msmeria> has quit  
16:01 <lucaa> it was not really a bug, but nobody had used it with the old functioning that much  
16:01 <tmortagne> we broke an API when we did it and we tough it was ok to break it  
16:02 <tmortagne> but it's till a breackage  
16:02 <tmortagne> and there is no much you can do about it  
16:02 <lucaa> I am doing the same thing, just wanted to know if I could mark it anyhow other than in the release notes  
16:02 <tmortagne> nothing I can think of  
16:02 <lucaa> ok, thanks

16:19 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki

16:43 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
16:46 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <polx> has quit  
16:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: I think I fixed the failing rendering tests with that commit  
16:49 <vmassol> ah cool  
16:49 <tmortagne> spent the day on it since it was a real pain to debug, it's very random on my side  
16:49 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:49 <tmortagne> looks like order of methods is not stable anymore in Java 7  
16:49 <vmassol> yes it was random on my side too  
16:50 <vmassol> always failing but not at the same place  
16:50 <tmortagne> it was a but but invisible on Java 6  
16:50 <vmassol> maybe we need a default value for the annotation?  
16:51 <vmassol> the @Default anno that is  
16:51 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
16:51 <tmortagne> there is a default value, it's null  
16:51 <tmortagne> but null is wrong for this parameter that's all  
16:52 <vmassol> ok  
16:52 <vmassol> it's an anno to describe the default ;)  
16:52 <tmortagne> yes  
16:52 <tmortagne> it indicate what is the default value for the parameter  
16:52 <polx> has quit  
16:52 <tmortagne> (mostly used in XML to know if it's really needed to serialize it)  
16:52 <Sidali\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:53 <vmassol> shouldn't be an empty collection for  Map<String, String> parameters?  
16:53 <vmassol> (instead of null)  
16:53 <tmortagne> yes could be great, I will let you try ;)  
16:53 <vmassol> hehe  
16:54 <Sidali> has quit  
16:54 <tmortagne> I find annotation values restriction a bit of a pain  
16:54 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <vmassol> yep

20:02 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
20:04 <vmassol> has quit  
20:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
20:36 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
20:40 <lucaa> hi devs  
20:41 <lucaa> would you appreciate that there is a performance penalty in using on demand translation documents all over the place?  
20:42 <lucaa> e.g. if I have a bunch of applications and little scripted features here and there on my wiki, would it be a problem if all these little scripts would be using their own translation documents on demand which will be loaded and unloaded depending on the page?  
20:45 <vmassol1> lucaa: sorry, I don't know enough about how on demand translations work behind the scene, would need to check code. I guess best is to ask tmortagne tomorrow  
20:45 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
20:49 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
20:50 <tmortagne> lucaa: translation bundles, even the on demand bundles are caches so it's not a big issue  
20:51 <tmortagne> one more call to use() means more or less one more call to Map#get  
20:51 <tmortagne> and one more element in the list of context bundles to parse  
20:52 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
20:52 <tmortagne> in short no its not going to be loaded and unloaded each time  
20:52 <tmortagne> unless there is so much bundles that the bundles cache is full  
21:05 <tmortagne> has quit  
21:12 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
21:32 <polx> has quit  
21:34 <polx> has joined #xwiki

21:41 <lucaa> ok. Thanks, Thomas
